statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

article.description: Lamar Odom and Corey Maggette triggered a quick start and Quentin Richardson scored 23 points as the Clippers snapped a seven-game home losing streak to the Seattle SuperSonics, 114-94.
article.headline: Resurgent Clippers claim third straight victory
article.linkText: Clips do what Lakers couldn't: beat Sonics at Staples
article.story:
LOS ANGELES (AP) -- Maybe it's time to start taking the Los Angeles Clippers seriously. Quentin Richardson scored 23 points, and Elton Brand had 18 points and 10 rebounds Wednesday night as the Clippers took command early in a 114-94 victory over the Seattle SuperSonics. Just 24 hours earlier at Staples Center, the Sonics beat the two-time defending NBA champion Los Angeles Lakers 104-93. But they were never in this game. "The Clippers are playing good basketball," said Brent Barry, who led the Sonics with 18 points. "They've got a good thing going here, hats off to them. They played a great game." Barry began his NBA career with the Clippers in 1995, and played two full seasons and part of a third with them before being traded to Miami. So he remembers the bad times, and there were many. "They've got some good young players," Barry said. "Hopefully, people will jump on their bandwagon, because it's going to be a wild ride, if they keep them." The win was the third straight and fifth in six games for the Clippers (12-10), who are over .500 later than at any time in a season since March 5, 1993. Jeff McInnis had 19 points and six assists, Corey Maggette added 17 points, and Lamar Odom had 15 points, 10 rebounds and eight assists for the Clippers. "Obviously we played as well as we could possibly play," Clippers coach Alvin Gentry said. "Not so much offensively, I wasn't worried about that; we did a great job defensively. "I thought Corey and those guys did as good a job as they could against Gary Payton. He played 36 minutes and got 14 points. He usually has that by the end of the first quarter." Payton had 29 points and 10 assists against the Lakers, and Vin Baker had 27 points and nine rebounds. Payton had seven assists to go with his 14 points against the Clippers, and Baker had 15 points and two rebounds. "They did a good job of jumping on us," Payton said. "Some nights, you just don't have it. If we had played our regular game, it might have been a different story." The Sonics are 0-8 in the second half of back-to-back games this season. When asked how his team could let down after its performance against the Lakers, Barry replied: "If I had that answer, I'd be a GM. I'd quit playing, and sit in an office all day. There's no excuse for it." The Clippers, who led all the way, got four points each from Maggette, Odom and McInnis in a 12-0 run that made it 19-5 after 6¾ minutes of play, and it was 70-45 at halftime. The Sonics didn't pose a threat in the second half. "We scored 70 points in the first half, that's big-time," Odom said. "We really wanted this one, we knew how big it was." Seattle was 14-1 against the Clippers during the last four years, and 34-4 against them in the last nine seasons. In addition, the Sonics had won their last seven games against the Clippers in Los Angeles, and were 8-1 at Staples Center since it opened in October 1999 -- 4-0 against the Clippers, and 4-1 against the Lakers. Odom had nine points and five assists, and Maggette also had nine points in the first period, which ended with the Clippers leading 33-21 thanks mainly to a 15-of-23 shooting performance. The Clippers didn't cool in the second quarter, going 14-of-24 while increasing their lead to 25 points. The 70 points were the most they've scored in a half this season, and their 114 points were also a season-high.

Game notes
The Clippers' next game is Friday night against the Lakers, who have lost two straight. The Lakers haven't lost three in a row in 221 games including the playoffs since Phil Jackson became their coach before the 1999-2000 season. ... The Sonics put center Calvin Booth, who has started 15 games, on the injured list due to a sprained right ankle. They didn't immediately replace him on their roster. ... Seattle's Vladimir Radmanovic sprained his right ankle in the third quarter and didn't return. ... Clippers guard Eric Piatkowski, who started the first 16 games of the season before sitting out the next five due to a strained right hip flexor, returned to play most of the fourth quarter, with the outcome decided, and didn't score. ... The Clippers have played 17 home games, most in the NBA, and five road games, fewest in the league. ... The Sonics have played a league-high 25 games.
